AD_ShadowlandsComment.speaker: Sentient Amulet
AD_ShadowlandsComment.text: Darkness. Desolation. The Dark Lady's hand at work, mayhaps? HahaHA-HEE!
AD_ShadowlandsComment.context: NodeContext: Said with the laughing madness so common to the character.

DeadHarper.speaker: Harper Lightspark
DeadHarper.text: Scouting... seeking... gaps in cultist defences...

AD_CreepyNoises001.speaker: Object
AD_CreepyNoises001.text: She was no fun. All I wanted was to play.
AD_CreepyNoises001.context: NodeContext: Disappointed. Referring to a dead githyanki the player comes across.

AD_Sign.speaker: Narrator
AD_Sign.text:
*North - Last Light Inn
South - Risen Road
West - Reithwin Town*

PAD_Curse_4Characters.speaker: Player
PAD_Curse_4Characters.text: |There's no time to waste, we should get away from the darkness.|

PAD_Curse_4Characters.speaker: Player
PAD_Curse_4Characters.text: |Good idea. Maybe there's somewhere safe from it?|

node_data.text: You look like you want to say the magic words. Like they're right on the tip of your lips...
Don't you snurl at me, you nasty cow!

PAD_FoundRolan.speaker: Player
PAD_FoundRolan.text: Is that Rolan? I thought he had better sense than this.

AD_AgainstShadows.speaker: Rolan
AD_AgainstShadows.text: I am Rolan, apprentice to Lorroakan himself - do not try me!
AD_AgainstShadows.context: NodeContext: exhausted and scared, but trying not to sound it

PAD_DeadDruids.speaker: Player
PAD_DeadDruids.text: There was a battle here once - a large one.

PAD_ShadowlandDevastation.speaker: Player
PAD_ShadowlandDevastation.text: Hells. The curse has torn open the ground itself...

HalfOrcCaster_Checkpoint.speaker: Kansif
HalfOrcCaster_Checkpoint.text: Hold there! One step closer and -

HalfOrcCaster_Checkpoint.speaker: Kansif
HalfOrcCaster_Checkpoint.text: True Soul - forgive me, I did not see you in the dark.

HalfOrcCaster_Checkpoint.speaker: Player
HalfOrcCaster_Checkpoint.text: I could kill you for speaking to me like that.

HalfOrcCaster_Checkpoint.speaker: Kansif
HalfOrcCaster_Checkpoint.text: If it was the Absolute's will.

HalfOrcCaster_Checkpoint.speaker: Kansif
HalfOrcCaster_Checkpoint.text: But you had best wait until we get to Moonrise. Otherwise you might be missing a guide through the darkness.

HalfOrcCaster_Checkpoint.speaker: Kansif
HalfOrcCaster_Checkpoint.text: Speak to me if you are ready to leave. Until then - welcome to the shadow curse.

AD_Dome50PercentHP.speaker: Oliver
AD_Dome50PercentHP.text: You're spoiling my fun! Stop it right now, or you'll be sorry!
AD_Dome50PercentHP.context: NodeContext: Angry (player is attacking a magic dome shielding Oliver, reducing its integrity by 50%)

AD_StartOfFight.speaker: Oliver
AD_StartOfFight.text: You should have just left me alone!

AD_StartOfFight.speaker: Oliver
AD_StartOfFight.text: Spoil my fun? I'll teach you a lesson - just you watch.

AD_Dome25PercentHP.speaker: Oliver
AD_Dome25PercentHP.text: Why are you doing this? All I wanted to do was play!
AD_Dome25PercentHP.context: NodeContext: Angry (player has reduced a magic dome shielding Oliver to 25% integrity)

AD_FriendsSummoned.speaker: Oliver
AD_FriendsSummoned.text: I'll make my own fun if I have to - and my own friends.

AD_SummoningPlush.speaker: Oliver
AD_SummoningPlush.context: NodeContext: he's summoning toys to fight the players - malicious, but playful

node_data.speaker: Hyena
node_data.text: You came back? Am I - are you a friend?

node_data.speaker: Hyena
node_data.context: NodeContext: small sad voice, afraid he'll be beaten

node_data.speaker: Hyena
node_data.text: That makes me happy. I like the goblins, but the goblins... don't like me.
node_data.context: NodeContext: happy in the first half and then sadness and shame in the rest

node_data.speaker: Hyena
node_data.text: They beat me because I am weak. Because I am soft. Even though I try my best.
node_data.context: NodeContext: full of shame and sadness. He feels like he deserves it.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: You belong to the wild, not to the goblins. Go and be free.

node_data.speaker: Hyena
node_data.text: But - but the goblins said I must stay here. Or they'll cut me. Kill me.
node_data.context: NodeContext: player is trying to convince hyena to leave. He want to but he's terrified of the goblins

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: If not now, when? Go on - while you still can.

node_data.speaker: Hyena
node_data.text: You're right. The goblins are cruel.

node_data.speaker: Hyena
node_data.text: I - I'm scared. But I don't want them to hurt me anymore. Maybe I should go...
node_data.context: NodeContext: scared but growing more confident

node_data.speaker: Hyena
node_data.context: NodeContext: summon his courage - he's about to run away but not before he thanks his new friend

PAD_DarkJusticiarRemains.speaker: Shadowheart
PAD_DarkJusticiarRemains.text: Dark Justiciars fell here. Those signs we saw before were no coincidence - they led us here.
PAD_DarkJusticiarRemains.context: NodeContext: Captivated. Arc: SH is loyal to shar. Starting to vocalise a sneaking suspicion that this temple is a legendary Sharran site, before dismissing the thought.

PAD_ReadResearch.speaker: Player
PAD_ReadResearch.text: Research on the nature of the shadow curse. Good to know.

PAD_InvestigatedKidnapping.speaker: Player
PAD_InvestigatedKidnapping.context: NodeContext: Commenting on the aftermath of a skirmish - some dead refugees like about.

000_AD_DriderDropsLantern.speaker: Harper Lassandra
000_AD_DriderDropsLantern.text: The lantern's down - we need to get it!

000_AD_TakesMoonlantern.speaker: Harper Lassandra
000_AD_TakesMoonlantern.text: The Moonlantern's ours! Let's finish this and go home.

Dead.speaker: Goblin Brawler
Dead.text: Curse... Them shadows... Got teeth too...

VB_RoadToPlains.speaker: Player
VB_RoadToPlains.text: It's brighter up ahead. Looks like the plains.

StayInSCL.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
StayInSCL.text: If you intend to stray from Moonrise while Ketheric still lives, I shall remain at camp, strategising his downfall.

StayInSCL.speaker: Player
StayInSCL.text: I have unfinished business to attend to before dealing with Ketheric.

StayInSCL.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
StayInSCL.text: I do not. All that I did before you rescued me was as a puppet of the Absolute - it is behind me. Until Ketheric falls, only vengeance remains.

StayInSCL.speaker: Halsin
StayInSCL.text: I cannot venture back with you - now that I am in a position to fight the curse, I must stay here and see it through.
StayInSCL.context: NodeContext: Some urgency. Halsin doesn't want to backtrack to previous regions while he's close to achieving his goals.

StayInSCL.speaker: Player
StayInSCL.text: Have it your way, then. Find somewhere safe to camp and I'll see you when I return.

StayInSCL.speaker: Halsin
StayInSCL.text: Very well. I shall seek out your camp as soon as you find yourself amidst the curse again.

VB_DirtpileGas.speaker: Player
VB_DirtpileGas.text: Argh! This air is foul with rot. Better be careful...

VB_Revitalized.speaker: Player
VB_Revitalized.text: That place is cursed; I feel better just for having left it.

PAD_FindAnimal.speaker: Player
PAD_FindAnimal.text: The animal never had a chance. The curse consumes everything it touches.

PAD_ShadowheartBlessed.speaker: Shadowheart
PAD_ShadowheartBlessed.text: The Dark Lady shields me - I can feel her.
PAD_ShadowheartBlessed.context: NodeContext: Commenting on having divine protection from a shadow curse that affects all others

PAD_WantsOintment.speaker: Player
PAD_WantsOintment.text: Here we go - if there's any of that ointment left, I could use it.

PAD_WantsOintment.speaker: Player
PAD_WantsOintment.text: Same here. I don't want to face whatever's out there unprotected.

PAD_LightsSnuffedOut.speaker: Player
PAD_LightsSnuffedOut.text: Hells. Torchlight won't last long here.

ShadowMemory4.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory4.text: *You sense a fading echo of the person who once was. A dockhand. He did not ask for this.*

ShadowMemory20.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory20.text: *A distant memory of a man stretching his back with a groan. Another day of hauling masonry blocks done...*

ShadowMemory8.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory8.text: *She was a healer, trying to aid the wounded in the battle against the Sharrans. But there were so many...*

ShadowMemory16.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory16.text: *You sense a matriarch's flush of pride - she will soon be a grandmother, and the child will bear her name. Muldred.*

Entrance_Plaque3.speaker: Narrator
Entrance_Plaque3.text: *We offer ourselves to the darkness, that blessed Shar may give us her mercy.*

ShadowMemory17.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory17.text: *Callused hands work a hammer and chisel around a massive slab of rock. Months from now, a face will take shape.*

ShadowMemory9.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory9.text: *You see a man stalking slowly through the woods, bow half-drawn. If he bags a deer, the whole family will be kept fed all winter...*

ShadowMemory21.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory21.text: *You can almost taste the sour ale that once clung to this soul's breath. He was insensible when the shadows came for him.*

ShadowMemory5.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory5.text: *You glimpse a young Harper on the eve of battle against Thorm, long ago. He and his comrades toast each other in Last Light...*

ShadowMemory10.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory10.text: *In her former life, this girl played in the nearby woods. She was always the best at climbing trees.*

ShadowMemory2.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory2.text: *You can almost feel the heat from the forge. This one was once a blacksmith.*

ShadowMemory26.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory26.text: *You sense a faded memory of marching in an army against Ketheric Thorm. Victory seemed possible then.*

ShadowMemory30.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory30.text: *An echo of the past shows a man hunched over a ledger, quill in hand. Tolls collected on the Risen Road, destined for Moonrise.*

ShadowMemory31.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory31.text: *You see a man drain his tankard in an inn as he listens to a Flaming Fist play the lute. He's better than his uniform might suggest.*

ShadowMemory27.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory27.text: *You can almost smell the hops and barley for yourself. This man's family always complained that his clothing reeked after work at the brewery.*

ShadowMemory3.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory3.text: *Desperate prayers to Selûne, echoing from the past. They did not save him.*

ShadowMemory11.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory11.text: *You see an older woman, on her knees, scrubbing the floor of an inn. The patrons made a mess of things again the night before.*

ShadowMemory28.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory28.text: *You hear the heavy thud of a butcher's cleaver on his block, as he divides his meagre fare for those waiting. Never enough to go around.*

ShadowMemory12.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory12.text: *He had dreams of boarding a ship in Baldur's Gate, and seeing the world. But then the darkness came.*

ShadowMemory32.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory32.text: *An older man turns his head away in shame. His neighbours would not renounce Selûne - now they hang in the town square.*

ShadowMemory24.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory24.text: *A strange feeling of resentment comes to you. A travelling merchant, sick of this route. Sick of the tolls eating away his profits.*

ShadowMemory1.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory1.text: *A faded memory of a boy and girl sharing their first kiss. Your own heart almost flutters in tune with theirs.*

ShadowMemory25.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory25.text: *You see an old boot, balanced upside down on a cobbler's knee, as he taps the final nail into the new sole. Good as new.*

ShadowMemory33.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory33.text: *You feel a rush of outrage. This woman worshipped Shar to the end - so why does the Nightsinger's curse not spare her...?*

ShadowMemory13.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory13.text: *You sense a young woman, gazing at Moonrise Towers in awe. Perhaps one day she will get to gaze out from atop it, she hopes.*

ShadowMemory29.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory29.text: *You see a mother sitting by her child's bedside, listening to his sickly breathing as he sleeps.*

ShadowMemory22.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory22.text: *A happy, faded memory comes to you. A woman walking along a beach, holding hands with her husband-to-be.*

ShadowMemory6.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory6.text: *Thoughts of baby names. She did not wish for her first born to be named after her mother-in-law. Muldred. Ugh.*

ShadowMemory18.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory18.text: *You sense this one hid for days as the sounds of battle got closer and closer to town. You didn't even care who won, so long as it ended.*

ShadowMemory14.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory14.text: *The image of an orange-haired cat asleep before a fireplace comes to you. What came of it?*

Entrance_Plaque1.speaker: Narrator
Entrance_Plaque1.text: *We offer our prayers to the Dark Lady, whose comfort and grace heals all.*

ShadowMemory15.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory15.text: *You sense a swell of grief. Before the shadows took her, this woman mourned someone lost in battle.*

ShadowMemory19.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory19.text: *Before the shadows, there was once a house full of warmth a childrens' laughter in this one's life. No more.*

ShadowMemory23.speaker: Narrator
ShadowMemory23.text: *As the pile of sawdust on the floor grows larger, the cabinet gradually takes shape. The carpenter's pride washes over you...*

PAD_Approach.speaker: Player
PAD_Approach.text: A dead bird. What happened to it?
PAD_Approach.context: NodeContext: Reacting to coming across a dead bird in the shadow-cursed lands.

AD_EmeraldEnclaveFallen.speaker: Narrator
AD_EmeraldEnclaveFallen.text: *Fallen members of the Emerald Enclave. Casualties in the war against Ketheric Thorm, years past.*

Harper_Melee_000_AD_DriderDies.speaker: Harper Branthos
Harper_Melee_000_AD_DriderDies.text: Big and ugly's down - grab the lantern!

Caravan_AD_HalfOrcCaster.speaker: Kansif
Caravan_AD_HalfOrcCaster.text: You will die here - the Absolute wills it so!

ThanksAfterAmbush.speaker: Kar'niss
ThanksAfterAmbush.text: And what of the strange little turncoat, Majesty? Should we spare them?

ThanksAfterAmbush.speaker: Narrator
ThanksAfterAmbush.text: *Your minds connect and you hear a whispered voice. The Absolute? Or just the echoes of his fractured mind, reverberating in the dark?*

ThanksAfterAmbush.speaker: Kar'niss
ThanksAfterAmbush.text: A True Soul. Why would one of our queen's blessed walk with Harpers?

ThanksAfterAmbush.speaker: Player
ThanksAfterAmbush.text: I infiltrated their ranks - gathering information for our cause.

ThanksAfterAmbush.speaker: Kar'niss
ThanksAfterAmbush.text: Very well. We welcome all who follow our holy queen.

ThanksAfterAmbush.speaker: Kar'niss
ThanksAfterAmbush.text: Are they ready to depart? We do not want to linger in the shadows, Majesty.

ThanksAfterAmbush.speaker: Kar'niss
ThanksAfterAmbush.text: Follow close - the shadows are hungry. Do not stray from the light.

HarperRanger_001_AfterAmbush.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player lifts lantern and illuminates their face.

HarperRanger_001_AfterAmbush.speaker: Harper Skywin
HarperRanger_001_AfterAmbush.text: Incredible. A light that chases away even the deepest shadows.
HarperRanger_001_AfterAmbush.context: CinematicNodeContext: Musing, not really said to player.

HarperRanger_001_AfterAmbush.speaker: Narrator
HarperRanger_001_AfterAmbush.text: *The lantern flickers ever so briefly, and you hear a slight twitter - or perhaps it's simply your imagination.*
HarperRanger_001_AfterAmbush.context: CinematicNodeContext: Camera shows lantern in player's hand. The light flickers just a little, and you hear a little titter come from it. Player stows the lantern.

HarperRanger_001_AfterAmbush.speaker: Harper Skywin
HarperRanger_001_AfterAmbush.text: A face I once trusted, now allied with the shadows' most favoured.
HarperRanger_001_AfterAmbush.context: CinematicNodeContext:  Addressed to player. Harper raises bow and points at the player.NodeContext: Very suspicious

HarperRanger_001_AfterAmbush.speaker: Player
HarperRanger_001_AfterAmbush.text: I meant to infiltrate the cult. You've ruined the mission.

HarperRanger_001_AfterAmbush.speaker: Harper Skywin
HarperRanger_001_AfterAmbush.text: A lie, clear as the Chionthar's waters. And for that, you will bleed.

AD_HarpersAfterAmbush.speaker: Harper Branthos
AD_HarpersAfterAmbush.text: Stay on your toes - more cultists might still pass.

AD_HarpersAfterAmbush.speaker: Harper Elindale
AD_HarpersAfterAmbush.text: Then we'll gut them like the rest.

AD_HarpersAfterAmbush.speaker: Harper Skywin
AD_HarpersAfterAmbush.text: I say we head to Last Light. There's a wine bottle calling my name.

AD_HarpersReachAmbushHouse.text: Perfect spot for an ambush. Get into position.

Harper_Melee_000_AD_LassandraDies.speaker: Harper Branthos
Harper_Melee_000_AD_LassandraDies.context: NodeContext: Just watched your friend Lassandra die in combat

PlayersAmbush.speaker: Kar'niss
PlayersAmbush.text: Step into the light! Let us see you.

PlayersAmbush.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player moves into the light. Player's positioning should match N218 so it merges into the rest of the dialog flow

PlayersAmbush.speaker: Narrator
PlayersAmbush.text: *Your minds connect and you hear a voice whispering to you. The Absolute? Or just the echoes of his fractured mind, reverberating in the darkness?*

PlayersAmbush.speaker: Kar'niss
PlayersAmbush.text: One of your True Souls, my Queen! How have they survived?
PlayersAmbush.context: CinematicNodeContext: Scuttles forward, holding the lantern to illuminate the player's face

PlayersAmbush.speaker: Kar'niss
PlayersAmbush.text: You blessed them too, my Queen? Where is their lantern?

PlayersAmbush.speaker: Player
PlayersAmbush.text: Lantern? Is that what protects you out here?

PlayersAmbush.speaker: Kar'niss
PlayersAmbush.text: Our goddess protects us. We carry her sacred light to drive back the shadows.
PlayersAmbush.context: NodeContext: 'Sacred light' referring to the Moonlantern

PlayersAmbush.speaker: Kar'niss
PlayersAmbush.text: Yes, majesty, your light can shield another of your faithful. They will join us on the road.

PlayersAmbush.speaker: Player
PlayersAmbush.text: Or I could kill you and take that light.

Caravan_AD_Hyena.speaker: Hyena
Caravan_AD_Hyena.context: NodeContext: Worg pup - sounds like a growl, but actually haltingly articulating a word (they can speak)

Caravan_AD_Hyena.speaker: Warrior Gronag
Caravan_AD_Hyena.text: Don't make eyes at me, you breech-blossom.
Caravan_AD_Hyena.context: NodeContext: Colourful goblin equivalent of 'shit-stain'. Said indignantly.

HarperCaster_000.speaker: Harper Elindale
HarperCaster_000.text: Heard you're planning to infiltrate Moonrise, and take the fight to Ketheric. That'd be a tale for the ages.

HarperCaster_000.speaker: Harper Elindale
HarperCaster_000.text: But the curse is at its strongest between here and there. You won't even reach the tower unless you can survive the darkest shadows.

HarperCaster_000.speaker: Harper Elindale
HarperCaster_000.text: There's a cultist convoy that brings supplies and personnel to the tower - by some strange magic, they move through the curse unharmed.

HarperCaster_000.speaker: Harper Elindale
HarperCaster_000.text: With your help, we'll ambush them, and seize their secret. When we do, it's yours, and the path to Moonrise will be open.

HarperCaster_000.speaker: Player
HarperCaster_000.text: Go on ahead. I'll catch up.

HarperCaster_000.speaker: Harper Elindale
HarperCaster_000.text: You got it. Here - I'll mark your map. But don't keep me waiting.

CaravanStart.speaker: Kar'niss
CaravanStart.text: Your worshippers, Majesty. What happened here?
CaravanStart.context: CinematicNodeContext: Drider arrives to find the camp deserted apart from you and some dead goblins.InternalNodeContext: Drider arrives to find the camp has been slaughteredNodeContext: Looking around at dead goblins - his allies have been slaughtered

CaravanStart.speaker: Kar'niss
CaravanStart.context: CinematicNodeContext: Turns and looks at the player with malevolenceNodeContext: Turns and looks at the player with malevolence

CaravanStart.speaker: Player
CaravanStart.text: I just found them like this.

CaravanStart.speaker: Kar'niss
CaravanStart.text: At least these have survived. At least we return with some faithful.

CaravanStart.speaker: Kar'niss
CaravanStart.text: But we should depart. Are they ready to leave?
CaravanStart.context: NodeContext: Looks out to the dark, then back to players

CaravanStart.speaker: Lae'zel
CaravanStart.text: Every step into the darkness leads us away from the crèche. Cleansing awaits - do not lose sight of our prize.

CaravanStart.speaker: Player
CaravanStart.text: What's out there? What makes the shadows so dangerous?

CaravanStart.speaker: Kar'niss
CaravanStart.text: Hungry shades and cursed darkness. Cursed by a lesser god, but dangerous all the same, oh yes.

CaravanStart.speaker: Kar'niss
CaravanStart.text: Our queen's light will keep them at bay. Will keep us safe as we guide Her faithful to Her temple, but only if they stay close.

CaravanStart.speaker: Kar'niss
CaravanStart.text: So why are we still waiting, Majesty? Why have we not left?

CaravanStart.speaker: Kar'niss
CaravanStart.text: They must follow close, Majesty. They must not leave the light.

HarperScout_PreparingForAmbush.speaker: Harper Lassandra
HarperScout_PreparingForAmbush.text: Listen - if you want to reach Moonrise, you're going to need help. And I know where you'll find it.

HarperScout_PreparingForAmbush.speaker: Harper Lassandra
HarperScout_PreparingForAmbush.text: There's a cultist convoy that passes each day. It carries a lantern that burns the curse away.

HarperScout_PreparingForAmbush.speaker: Harper Lassandra
HarperScout_PreparingForAmbush.text: You're going to seize that lantern - and I'm going to help you. Just say the word.

HarperScout_PreparingForAmbush.speaker: Player
HarperScout_PreparingForAmbush.text: Let's take on that convoy. You lead, I follow.

HarperScout_PreparingForAmbush.speaker: Harper Lassandra
HarperScout_PreparingForAmbush.text: Wonderful. I will mark your map, so you can find us, should you lose the way.

AD_AllHarpersWaitingAtAmbush.speaker: Harper Branthos
AD_AllHarpersWaitingAtAmbush.text: All right. You ready for this?

CINE_CaravanIntro.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player pauses as they hear nearby footfalls. They crouch down and observe.

CINE_CaravanIntro.speaker: Kar'niss
CINE_CaravanIntro.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player observes as the drider caravan moves into frame (wide shot).NodeContext: Urging the caravan along.

HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player lifts lantern and illuminates their face.

HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush.speaker: Harper Branthos
HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush.text: Incredible. A light so radiant, not even the curse can dim it.
HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush.context: CinematicNodeContext: Musing, not really said to player.

HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush.speaker: Narrator
HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush.text: *The lantern flickers ever so briefly, and you hear a slight twitter - or perhaps it's simply your imagination.*
HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush.context: CinematicNodeContext: Camera shows lantern in player's hand. The light flickers just a little, and you hear a little titter come from it. Player stows the lantern.

HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush.speaker: Harper Branthos
HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush.text: You. Don't move a godsdamned muscle.
HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to player. Harper raises his blade and points at the player.

HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush.speaker: Harper Branthos
HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush.text: Talk. Why in the hells would a cultist turn on their kind?

HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush.speaker: Narrator
HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush.text: *The pin the man wears is familiar to you. He belongs to the Harpers, a covert organisation dedicated to freedom and balance.*
HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush.context: CinematicNodeContext: Camera shows the Harper's garb. We see a Harper pin on their chest.

HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush.speaker: Player
HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush.text: I'm not one of them. They took me prisoner.

HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush.speaker: Harper Branthos
HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush.text: A prisoner? Then I must be a welcome sight indeed.
HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush.context: CinematicNodeContext: Harper lowers blade while speaking.

HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush.speaker: Harper Branthos
HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush.text: Follow me. I know a refuge from the darkness. You can rest there.

HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush.speaker: Player
HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush.text: I will make my way there in my own time.

HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush.speaker: Harper Branthos
HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush.text: A dangerous choice - but yours to make. I will mark your map.

HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush.speaker: Harper Branthos
HarperMelee_000_AfterAmbush.text: But don't linger for long. The shadows are not known to take pity.

WaitingDuringEscort.speaker: Kar'niss
WaitingDuringEscort.text: Do not stray from the light, little one. The shadows are hungry.
WaitingDuringEscort.context: NodeContext: panicking a little, twitchy. Stopped momentarily in a dangerous region

WaitingDuringEscort.speaker: Kar'niss
WaitingDuringEscort.text: We must reach Moonrise - She waits there for us. Hurry, hurry, and be done with the darkness.
WaitingDuringEscort.context: NodeContext: concerned, anxious. 'She' is his god

Harper_Melee_000_AD_TakesMoonlantern.speaker: Harper Branthos
Harper_Melee_000_AD_TakesMoonlantern.text: I have the lantern! Let's finish this up and go home.

AtTower.speaker: Kar'niss
AtTower.text: An interloper receives the Majesty's blessing before us?
AtTower.context: NodeContext: Looking at us with barely-reined in disgust - he is more deserving thatn we are, surely

AtTower.speaker: Kar'niss
AtTower.context: NodeContext: Leaning forward with glint of madness - could be take as encouragement or threat

AD_Harper_Melee_000.speaker: Harper Branthos
AD_Harper_Melee_000.text: I fear neither shadow nor death.
AD_Harper_Melee_000.context: NodeContext: during combat, like a prayer, reassuring self

HarperRanger_000_AfterAmbush.speaker: Harper Manus
HarperRanger_000_AfterAmbush.text: Splendid show - newsworthy, even! Where's Volo Geddarm when you need him?

HarperRanger_000_AfterAmbush.speaker: Harper Manus
HarperRanger_000_AfterAmbush.text: Go on, check the drider. The lantern's yours for the taking.

Caravan_HalfOrcMelee_AtTower.speaker: Bedi
Caravan_HalfOrcMelee_AtTower.text: Her cathedral will stand in the city, True Soul. On the bones of all Baldurians.
Caravan_HalfOrcMelee_AtTower.context: NodeContext: grave, taking himself too seriously

Caravan_HalfOrcMelee.speaker: Bedi
Caravan_HalfOrcMelee.text: Stay sharp. These shadows can sneak up on you.

AD_CombatStarts.speaker: Kar'niss
AD_CombatStarts.text: Drive them into the dark! Do not let them take our light!

PAD_BacktrackedToCaravanCheckpoint.speaker: Player
PAD_BacktrackedToCaravanCheckpoint.text: Looks like the drider's caravan came from here.

PAD_BacktrackedToCaravanCheckpoint.speaker: Player
PAD_BacktrackedToCaravanCheckpoint.text: Cages, shackles... all prepared to march captives off to their fate.

AD_Harper_Caster_000.speaker: Harper Elindale
AD_Harper_Caster_000.context: NodeContext: wary but energetic, in combat

Caravan_GoblinRanger_AtTower.speaker: Sharp-Eye Lora
Caravan_GoblinRanger_AtTower.text: No food waiting for us? 'S barbaric. They got plenty of prisoners for the roasting.
Caravan_GoblinRanger_AtTower.context: NodeContext: whining - end of a long shift and they haven't been fed

HarpersAtInn.speaker: Harper Branthos
HarpersAtInn.text: You mean to reach Moonrise. And I've orders to help you.

HarpersAtInn.speaker: Harper Branthos
HarpersAtInn.text: The path to the Towers is drenched in blackness so deep, even a torch cannot quell it.

HarpersAtInn.speaker: Harper Branthos
HarpersAtInn.text: Yet the cultists have found a way to move freely. Whatever this method, you must claim it.

HarpersAtInn.speaker: Harper Branthos
HarpersAtInn.text: A cultist convoy crosses the land as we speak. I've readied an ambush. Say the word, and we fly.

AD_EscortInterrupted.speaker: Kar'niss
AD_EscortInterrupted.text: Return to the light! Do not stray!
AD_EscortInterrupted.context: NodeContext: Drider notices the player has left the safety of the caravan and wandered off into dangerous ground

Caravan_GoblinMelee_000_AtTower.speaker: Brawler Vez
Caravan_GoblinMelee_000_AtTower.text: Wish we was assigned to the war camp. Beer's surely better down there.

AD_HarpersPreparingBeforeAmbush.speaker: Harper Branthos
AD_HarpersPreparingBeforeAmbush.text: When the times comes, move quick, move quiet.

AD_HarpersPreparingBeforeAmbush.speaker: Harper Skywin
AD_HarpersPreparingBeforeAmbush.text: And just when will that be?

Caravan_AD_MeleeAndRangerGoblinsAtCheckp.speaker: Sharp-Eye Lora
Caravan_AD_MeleeAndRangerGoblinsAtCheckp.text: Ain't you worried about the shadows?

Caravan_AD_MeleeAndRangerGoblinsAtCheckp.speaker: Brawler Vez
Caravan_AD_MeleeAndRangerGoblinsAtCheckp.text: Nope. 'Cause I ain't a little coward.

Dead.speaker: Kar'niss
Dead.text: Shepherding... the faithful... carrying... our Lady's light...

Caravan_GoblinMelee_001_AtTower.speaker: Warrior Gronag
Caravan_GoblinMelee_001_AtTower.text: Absolute's blessing on ya. Maybe Her design will throw us together again sometime.

AD_KillsSomeone.speaker: Kar'niss
AD_KillsSomeone.text: For the Absolute! For my queen!

Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_AtTower.speaker: Kansif
Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_AtTower.text: It was an honour to walk the shadows at your side. A little more inviting here though, eh?
Caravan_HalfOrcCaster_AtTower.context: NodeContext: formal, making a slight joke at the end

AD_Harper_Ranger_000.speaker: Harper Manus
AD_Harper_Ranger_000.context: NodeContext: in combat, menacing your enemies

AD_Warning.speaker: Kar'niss
AD_Warning.text: If they wander, we will not be responsible.

AD_Warning.speaker: Kar'niss
AD_Warning.text: If they die, it is their own fault.

Caravan_HalfOrcCaster.speaker: Kansif
Caravan_HalfOrcCaster.context: NodeContext: Bows their head slightly. This is their first time meeting a revered true soul

Caravan_HalfOrcCaster.speaker: Player
Caravan_HalfOrcCaster.text: Why do you need a lyre, exactly?

Caravan_HalfOrcCaster.speaker: Kansif
Caravan_HalfOrcCaster.text: I admit, I'm surprised a True Soul does not know this. Where are you headed, exactly?

AD_AfterAmbush.speaker: Kar'niss
AD_AfterAmbush.text: Shadows and heretics, Majesty. But they won't stop us. They can't stop us.
AD_AfterAmbush.context: NodeContext: Outburst - a little crazed as a whispering he's been hearing picks up again

AD_PlayerTakesMoonlantern.speaker: Kar'niss
AD_PlayerTakesMoonlantern.text: Return the lantern! You are not worthy to hold her light!

AD_ArriveToTollHouse.speaker: Kar'niss
AD_ArriveToTollHouse.text: Stay close. The shadows are darkest here - hungriest here.
AD_ArriveToTollHouse.context: NodeContext: Warning the others in your caravan - you're entering a very dangerous area.

AD_ArriveToTollHouse.speaker: Kar'niss
AD_ArriveToTollHouse.text: Do not stray from the light, no matter what they promise you.
AD_ArriveToTollHouse.context: NodeContext: Warning the others in your caravan - you're entering a very dangerous area.

HarperMelee_000.speaker: Harper Branthos
HarperMelee_000.text: We expect great things of you.

AD_CaravanConflict.speaker: Brawler Vez
AD_CaravanConflict.text: You look twitchy, stone-skin. Afraid of the dark?

AD_CaravanConflict.speaker: Kansif
AD_CaravanConflict.text: In this place? Only a fool wouldn't be.

Caravan_GoblinRanger.speaker: Sharp-Eye Lora
Caravan_GoblinRanger.text: I miss the camp. It's too quiet out here.

AD_AfterTollhouse.speaker: Brawler Vez
AD_AfterTollhouse.text: There's the tower now, big lad. Your breeches still clean?
AD_AfterTollhouse.context: NodeContext: talking to a half-orc fellow-cultist, not to player

AD_AfterTollhouse.speaker: Kansif
AD_AfterTollhouse.text: My blade is. But that can change - just keep talking.
AD_AfterTollhouse.context: NodeContext: talking to a goblin who disrespected you, but it's a mostly-friendly rivalry

AD_AfterTollhouse.speaker: Kar'niss
AD_AfterTollhouse.text: They will be silent! They approach your sanctuary, Majesty.
AD_AfterTollhouse.context: NodeContext: 'they' are cultists he's leading, slightly crazed, talking to his 'god'

Caravan_GoblinMelee_000.speaker: Brawler Vez
Caravan_GoblinMelee_000.text: Can we get movin'? Nabbed these boots from a gnome, and they don't bloody fit.

AD_HarpersMoveTowardsAmbush.speaker: Harper Branthos
AD_HarpersMoveTowardsAmbush.context: NodeContext: Very tense, but not shouting. Close to a loud whisper.

HarperNarrator_AfterAmbush.speaker: Narrator
HarperNarrator_AfterAmbush.text: *The hunter holds the lantern aloft. Its glow warms you through, chasing away the shadows in and around you.*

HarperNarrator_AfterAmbush.speaker: Narrator
HarperNarrator_AfterAmbush.text: *The lantern flickers ever so briefly, and you hear a slight twitter - or perhaps it's simply your imagination.*
HarperNarrator_AfterAmbush.context: CinematicNodeContext: Camera shows lantern in Harper's hand. The light flickers just a little, and you hear a little titter come from it. Harper stows the lantern.

HarperNarrator_AfterAmbush.speaker: Narrator
HarperNarrator_AfterAmbush.text: *The Harper demands an explanation. Why did you travel with cultists?*
HarperNarrator_AfterAmbush.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to player. Harper raises his blade and points at the player.NodeContext: Very suspicious

HarperNarrator_AfterAmbush.speaker: Player
HarperNarrator_AfterAmbush.text: I meant to infiltrate the cult. You've ruined the mission.

HarperNarrator_AfterAmbush.speaker: Narrator
HarperNarrator_AfterAmbush.text: *The Harper sees through your lies and readies for battle.*

AD_Harpers_AtInn_AfterAmbush.speaker: Harper Elindale
AD_Harpers_AtInn_AfterAmbush.text: There must be something more we can do, Bran.

AD_Harpers_AtInn_AfterAmbush.speaker: Harper Branthos
AD_Harpers_AtInn_AfterAmbush.text: Then give it time. We will see victory yet.

Caravan_AD_GoblinMelee_001.speaker: Warrior Gronag
Caravan_AD_GoblinMelee_001.text: I'll gut you in 'er name - for the Absolute!
Caravan_AD_GoblinMelee_001.context: NodeContext: 'er' here being a contraction of "her" (meaning the Absolute)

Caravan_GoblinMelee_001_AD_AtCheckpoint.speaker: Warrior Gronag
Caravan_GoblinMelee_001_AD_AtCheckpoint.context: NodeContext: Mumbled. Thought he heard something but quickly dismissed.

AD_HarperScout_003_Combat.speaker: Harper Karrow
AD_HarperScout_003_Combat.text: Yonas, no! What are you doing?

BridgePoint_003.speaker: Harper Karrow
BridgePoint_003.text: Made it. Go speak to the boss.

AD_HarperScout_001_Combat.speaker: Harper Meygan
AD_HarperScout_001_Combat.text: Shit - the shadows took Yonas. Make every strike count!

AD_HarperScout_000_WrongWarning.speaker: Harper Lassandra
AD_HarperScout_000_WrongWarning.text: That's not the way - come back!

Raven_AD_GoBack.speaker: Raven
Raven_AD_GoBack.text: You found the ledger? Guess you're not so useless. Get back to master, on the double!

Raven.speaker: Narrator
Raven.text: *There is a malevolence in this bird - rooted deep. It would not be wise to touch it.*

Memories.speaker: He Who Was
Memories.text: This one is a murderer who walks free. She deserves to be punished. Or will you deny her victims peace?
Memories.context: NodeContext: cold and calculated, trying to manipulate the playeer

Memories.speaker: Player
Memories.text: No. I don't have time for this.

Memories.speaker: He Who Was
Memories.text: You have denied her victims any chance of rest. I pray you sleep easy at night.
Memories.context: NodeContext: cold and calculated, trying to manipulate the player (totally does not hope the player sleeps easy)

Raven_AD_Bye.speaker: Raven
Raven_AD_Bye.text: I'd say bye, but you'll be dead soon! Hah!
Raven_AD_Bye.context: NodeContext: cruel and vicious, big laugh at the end

Circle_PAD.speaker: Player
Circle_PAD.text: A ritual circle. Looks like it was used in the crafting of Moonlanterns.

AD_ScreamingInsideLantern.text: OPEN THIS CAGE YOU MUNTING ARSEHOLE!
AD_ScreamingInsideLantern.context: NodeContext: 'munting' rhymes with 'bunting', made up swear word
